Class Contact

java.lang.Object
Contact
public class Contact extends Object
This is the class for contacts for the ContactsApp, of witch the contact objects are created from. Each Contact object has personal ID, first name, last name and phone number as mandatory information, as well as address and e-mail as optional information. They are stored at the objects private variables.
Author:
Harri Salminen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Contact()
    Default constructor is empty since all variables are validated during the process of adding a new Contact object to the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • Contact

      public Contact()
      Default constructor is empty since all variables are validated during the process of adding a new Contact object to the database.

  • Method Details

    • setPersonalId

      public void setPersonalId(String personalId)
      Method for setting personal ID. Personal ID is formed from day, month and year of birth, followed by +,- or A to indicate which century the person was born at. That is followed by 3 digits ranging from 002-899, and a checkmark at the end, being eiher a digit or capital letter from group {A,B,C,D,E,F,H,J,K,L,M,N,P,R,S,T,U,V,W,X,Y. So in total 11 characters, ddmmyyxnnnt. NOTE: the regular expression doesn't cover the actual dates and months yet.
      Parameters:
      personalId - The personal ID that user inputs, which gets validated against regular expression form.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for any reason.

    • getPersonalId

      public String getPersonalId()
      Simple method to get the personal ID stored in the object.
      Returns:
      The personal ID variable of object.

    • setFirstName

      public void setFirstName(String firstName)
      Method for setting the first name of Contact object. First name has to have a capital letter to start with, but it can contain uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as dashes in it, like in Jari-Pekka.
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name that user inputs, which gets validated against regular expression form.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for any reason.

    • getFirstName

      public String getFirstName()
      Simple method to get the first name stored in the object
      Returns:
      The first name variable of object

    • setLastName

      public void setLastName(String lastName)
      Method for setting the last name of Contact object. Like first name, last name has to have a capital letter to start with, but it can contain uppercase and lowercase letters, as well as dashes in it, like in Tuomainen-Suurela or McDonald.
      Parameters:
      lastName - The last name that user inputs, which then gets validated against a regular expression form
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the validation fails for any reason.

    • getLastName

      public String getLastName()
      Simple method to get the last name stored in the Contact object
      Returns:
      The last name variable of object

    • setPhoneNumber

      public void setPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber)
      Method for setting the phone number of Contact object. Phone number must start with Finnish country number +358, after which the phone number is entered in one string of digits, skipping the first zero. Since the phone number is at least 6 digits long without the leading zero, the regular expression for validation reflects that. Phone numbers only contain numbers in this case, after the country number.
      Parameters:
      phoneNumber - The phone number user inputs for validation against the regular expression.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the validation fails for any reason.

    • getPhoneNumber

      public String getPhoneNumber()
      Simple method to get the phone number stored in the Contact object.
      Returns:
      The phone number variable of object.

    • setAddress

      public void setAddress(String address)
      Method for setting the address for Contact object. The address starts with capital letter, followed by string of letters of variable length, followed by space and house number. The address can go on after this, with apartment block and apartment number, for example. Address can be left out suring object creation.
      Parameters:
      address - The address user inputs, that gets validated against the regular expression.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for any reason.

    • getAddress

      public String getAddress()
      Simple method to get the address stored at the object.
      Returns:
      The address variable of object.

    • setEmail

      public void setEmail(String email)
      Method for setting the e-mail address for Contact object. The address starts with username part, that can contain letters, digits, dashes and dots, followed by @-symbol, followed by domain name, a dot and top-level domain, such as .com or .fi. NOTE: The regular expression is lacking, missing support for top-level domains like .co.uk. Also the regular expression is missing special characters like ?, % or !. and Ã¥,Ã¤ and Ã¶.
      Parameters:
      email - The email user inputs for validation against the regular expression.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation fails for any reason.

    • getEmail

      public String getEmail()
      Simple method to get the e-mail address in Contact object.
      Returns:
      The e-mail variable of object.

    • toStringShort

      public String toStringShort()
      Method is utilized in search and update menus for short listing of available Contacts.
      Returns:
      Modified String containing personal ID, first name and last name of the Contact object.

    • ToStringWriteFile

      public String ToStringWriteFile()
      Method for writing a contact in a file in a specific, csv-style text line.
      Returns:
      String with contact variables divided by semicolons.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Method to help print out the full dataset of the Contact object. Utilized when updating a single entry or listing all object fully at main menu.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Modified String containing all the private variables of the Contact object.
